TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MessageFault extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an in-memory representation of a SOAP fault that can be passed to to create a message that contains a fault.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault> class any time you need an in-memory SOAP fault that can be modified and used to create a SOAP message that contains the fault information.
Typically, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault> class is used when implementing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IErrorHandler> interface. In this case, [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] passes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault> object and you use it for your specific needs (for example, you can customize the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault> or to log fault information). However, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault> can be used anywhere custom SOAP fault message handling is required.
## Examples The following code example shows the most common use of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault>. Both the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IErrorHandler.ProvideFault%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IErrorHandler.HandleError%2A> pass in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault> object that can be modified and returned to the system (in the case of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IErrorHandler.ProvideFault%2A>) or used to perform some custom fault-related behavior (in the case of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IErrorHandler.HandleError%2A>).
In this example, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IErrorHandler.ProvideFault%2A> method converts all <xref:System.Exception> objects into a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault> object that contains a <xref:System.ServiceModel.FaultException%601> object of type `GreetingFault` and returns that customized <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault> to [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)].
[!code-csharp[IErrorHandler#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/ierrorhandler/cs/ierrorhandler.cs#6)] [!code-vb[IErrorHandler#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/ierrorhandler/vb/ierrorhandler.vb#6)]

Docs.param: The used to write the detail element.
The version of the SOAP envelope to write.
Docs.summary: Invoked prior to writing the detail contents.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault.OnWriteDetail%2A> method to participate in the detail writing process. The default behavior is to call <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault.OnWriteStartDetail%2A> followed by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault.OnWriteDetailContents%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract void OnWriteDetailContents (System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter writer);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnWriteDetailContents(class System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The used to write the detail element.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a non-abstract derived class, writes the contents of the detail element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault.OnWriteDetailContents%2A> method is called subsequent to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageFault.OnWriteStartDetail%2A> and prior to writing the end element.
